\title{Position and Displacement Vectors} \\ %text A position vector connects Origin $(0,0)$ to a given point. A displacement vector connects any two vectors. For two point $A(a_1,a_2)$ and $B(b_1, b_2)$, their position and displacement vectors are are given by, %
\begin{align} \ora{A} \text{ (or $\ora{OA})$}&=\vector{a_1}{a_2}{} \\ \ora{B}\text{ (or $\ora{OB}$)}&=\vector{b_1}{b_2}{} \\ \ora{AB}= $\ora{B}-\ora{A}$&=\vector{(b_1-a_1)}{(b_2-a_2)}{} \end{align} \\
\title{Addition and Subtraction} \\ %text Since the components along each unit vector are in the same direction, any two vectors $\ora{A}$ and $\ora{B}$ can be added/subtracted as shown. % \begin{align} \ora{A}\pm\ora{B}&=\vector{(a_1\pm b_1)}{(a_2\pm b_2)}{} \end{align} \\
\title{Triangle Law} \\ %text For any three vectors $\ora{A}$, $\ora{B}$ and $\ora{C}$, % \begin{align} \ora{AB}+\ora{BC}=\ora{AC} \end{align} \\ %text This is known as the{\bf triangle law} of vector addition since the three displacement vectors $\ora{AB}$, $\ora{BC}$ and $\ora{AC}$ form a triangle. %
